website_summaries.verdict: An exceptionally rated cat house perfect for those looking for a cheaper, compact option.
pros: 2 door flaps for easy access and cat safety, though flaps are removable for cats who prefer open doors
Water-resistant materials can withstand rain or snow
cons: Not nearly as water resistant as company claims

customer_reviews.title: Great product!  Instructions for use by cat needed for cat
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think the cat would need his own set of user instructions, but I was wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Kiley P.

customer_reviews.title: Great value. Kitty is nice and warm even in the snow.
customer_reviews.text: Our cat needed a place to stay warm outside. He loves the cathe house. When he walks pit of his house his tummy is all warm so I know the heating pad is working good. Great value for the money. Our cat is about 18lbs so I would say it would fit upto a 25lb pet. Or a couple small cats.
customer_reviews.author: Crunchy moma with 3 boys

customer_reviews.title: My ferals loved this house last winter
customer_reviews.text: My ferals loved this house last winter, and still use it on cooler nights (with heating pad off). I wish it was waterproof but the trash bag worked well keeping them dry! The heating pad cover was filthy so that will need to be replaced this winter. Definitely would recommend this cat house!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Shelinsky

customer_reviews.title: My stray cat "Bubs" loved it!
customer_reviews.text: We kept this in our backyard for two months while we waiting for a cat rescue shelter to have room to take our little stray kitty that showed up skinny and hungry one day. He took to the shelter immediately and even became very protective of it. It warmed up nicely inside and he spent many cold nights inside staying warm. He didn't care for the plastic velcro door, though, so we kept it in place on one side and open on the other. Still very warm inside on the surface of the heating pad and through a blanket. Highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: bspenard

customer_reviews.title: May kill your pet!
customer_reviews.text: Be careful!!! It burnt up in the middle of the night with my pet pig inside 😭. Also burned another shed next to it. Thanks goodness I didn’t have the heated shelter agains the house it would have burnt my home down!!!!! I want to talk to someone maybe I should sue!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Terrence Stewart

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR THE OUTDOORS!
customer_reviews.text: Actually want to give it no stars. This is. It and outdoor house. The first sentence says do not place in direct sun or rain.... hello that would be outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: K&H Outdoor Kitty House, Heated
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Easy setup and assembly. Quality construction at a good price. Stray cat used it right away keeping her warm and safe. She is now a part of the household and living inside my house.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Pad doesn't heat, cord not protect with wire mesh
customer_reviews.text: Sooo disappointed! After 30 minutes pad was not warm. The cord is not wrapped. We are facing temperatures in the single digits and needed this for a runt cat I rescued that isn't very healthy. The description bragged about being certified and the best, advising other brands were imposters. I was unsuccessful in getting a hold of the seller. I really needed this to be EVERYTHING it claimed. Under some are pleased with it in other reviews. The quality is "pot luck." Good luck on getting one that works. I'm returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Man

customer_reviews.title: Loved by my Outdoor Cat and her new Kittens
customer_reviews.text: There was a small cat in distress that we started feeding in my backyard. We are in nyc and it’s still right before spring so it can be cold, specially at night. We purchased this bed for her when we noticed that she may be pregnant. She wouldn’t use it and we thought we wasted our money until one day we saw that she was saving it for her babies. She gave birth and it’s the perfect little house that keeps them safe and warm until they can fend for themselves. LOVE THIS PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: M. Abbas

customer_reviews.title: but I like the fact that I can leave the front of ...
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves the heated pad. He is a bit large for the house, but I like the fact that I can leave the front of the house open to give him more space.
customer_reviews.author: C Wood

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have a feral cat that I started feeding recently. He's very thin and the weather has been starting to get cold and there's been a lot of rain lately. The house was super easy to assemble but my concern is that it's not really weather proof and it doesn't seem like the sturdiest house. My biggest disappointment was the heating pad....it doesn't really heat up....very little. If he didn't need it right away and so badly, I would definitely have returned it but he needs something now. I will look into buying a different heating pad. I was surprised that this product has such high reviews....maybe I just got a defective heating pad.
customer_reviews.author: Millie

customer_reviews.title: Cats will not use
customer_reviews.text: Somebody dropped off 3 former housecats who currently live in my garage. I ordered 3 houses. Received 2. Seller did refund the third. But they arrived in a box from Chewy, not the seller. Later received a card in the mail from "Chewy" asking if I liked the product. I often order directly from Chewy and this is a questionable practice by this seller. The cats will not use these houses, have them inside the garage. One cat does use the warming mat inside another house and stays mildly warmer than the garage but still cold. Would not order from this seller or buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Baxters Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Very happy with qualitu!!
customer_reviews.text: High quality. We purchase 2 of the heated cat houses. One for our screened cat porch accessible from our master bedroom, and the other for our TNR Gerald we feed I our front porch. Easy to assemble, high quality features, plus the cord is wire wrapped for safety. During summer months, I unplug the house and temporarily remove the clear velcroed flap, stori g the flap under the house until winter.
customer_reviews.author: Roxane Caspary

customer_reviews.title: Winner, winner chicken dinner!
customer_reviews.text: We have several strays in our neighborhood, but one in particular devotedly adopted us a couple of weeks ago. She is now the premier backyard kitty, and such a kitty needs shelter from our upcoming Pacific Northwest weather. (We already have 3 indoor kitties, so this one needs to remain outdoors.) Aside from some shipping issues that delayed delivery by several days (Amazon even told us it was lost) we couldn’t be happier with this purchase. Judy the outdoor kitty took to it immediately. Hubby propped it up on cinder blocks for added weather protection and there’s a large patio cover, so rain doesn’t fall directly on the kitty house. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Gelato Girl

customer_reviews.title: Serves the purpose for my purchase
customer_reviews.text: This cat house provided exactly what I needed which was a place for a recent stray to get out of the heat and the rain. It is held together by velcro so it was easy to put together. I wouldn't really call it sturdy because a really strong wind (50 mph) might push it around but it works for most days. It stays dry inside and the cat likes that there is an opening on both ends. He was timid to go into a crate due to only one end being open. Yes, for a temporary solution it is fine. I would expect it to last for several months or a year.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Amazone Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hummmmm
customer_reviews.text: It does not keep the pad warm, not even a little bit when outside. The house itself is very well made and it has nice insulation but, if there is no source of heat, it is useless. Also, in the top front and back, there are 2 holes left between the roof and the walls that I had to cover with tape to make sure the wind/snow does not get inside. It was outside with 20 degrees and the inside had the same temperature as outside all the time. A complete shame. I throw the box away so I can't return. I guess I can buy another mat that actually works.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy G

customer_reviews.title: The heating pad is junk. Doesn't even feel warm ...
customer_reviews.text: The heating pad is junk. Doesn't even feel warm to the touch. the house itself is not for outdoor use, so we had to buy another house. We use this outside to keep the cat food in so the dogs don't eat it.
customer_reviews.author: rachyd2854

customer_reviews.title: He LOVES it
customer_reviews.text: Little old man, showed up at our house not sure where he came from, he was hungry and cold. Had him vetted, (vet estimated him to be 12 +) We wanted to make sure he was comfortable so we researched and found this house. He sure is enjoying the warmth and cozy cushion in his new house! We have put it up on a shelf in our garage with all of his other necessities. We couldn't be more happier with our purchase! This little guy never wants to come out of it! The cushion is really thick too. He hit the jackpot, probable the best house he has ever had. Very impressed with it, well put together!! THANK YOU!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lori Zebrasky

customer_reviews.title: NOT weatherproof/waterproof
customer_reviews.text: NOT AT ALL waterproof/resistant. It's pictured in the snow, but we had it under an eve where a little snow blew against it. When the snow melted a little, the house wicked it up like a rag and the entire thing was wet! Even the mat inside was wet. This is fine in the cold, but does NOT provide dry protection in the rain or snow. Should come with some sort of plastic or rubber bottom to keep it from wicking up moisture.
customer_reviews.author: Jaykay

customer_reviews.title: Great Cat Shelter
customer_reviews.text: This cat shelter is perfect for my cat. I purchased the unheated style. It was easy to assemble and I set it up in the house to see if he would try it out. No, he was not interested. I set it up on the front porch and he goes in there when its cold or rainy. It is exactly what I needed to offer protection for my pet. I like that it has two doors so he isn't ever trapped inside.
customer_reviews.author: Honna Momma

customer_reviews.title: An excellent product
customer_reviews.text: We have an outdoor feral visitor cat and we wanted a shelter that she would use and which would keep her healthy even in our Colorado winters. It actually it got its first real workout over the last three days and has performed brilliantly. The pad has worked to keep her warm, the plastic windows keep her snug while giving access options. The shelter is on our porch close to our door so we can check easily. Scherherezade is taken with her shelter. Great product heartily recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wenlock

customer_reviews.title: Nice cat house, did not come with protected cord
customer_reviews.text: I removed the cat house/bed from the box and set it up and it seems to be made well, however mine was missing the metal coil cord protector. Other customer photos, the instructions, and the picture on the box all show the cord to be covered for kitty chew protection. Also this would be a tight fit for my cat. I am still giving 4 stars because I'm sure the missing cord protector was just an oversight and most cats could probably fit comfortably inside. Also mine DID come with plastic removable door flaps, and was very very simple to assemble. Unfortunately after much consideration I have opted to return.
customer_reviews.author: LexiTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: New cat houses are missing...
customer_reviews.text: These have been a lifesaver for the feral cats. Have 7 filled right now. Very disappointed they have stopped wrapping the heating pad cord with wire. I just called them to see if the new one I recently ordered was a fluke because no wire. Nope. Discontinued it because it was determined cats don't chew cords. Huh? I said it was more to cut your costs that you stopped. Very disappointed. Don't leave things that work alone-always trying to save money that results in cheapening the product. I will have to wrap the cords with tubing that I will slice and wrap around cord to protect it.
customer_reviews.author: James G.

customer_reviews.title: Lasted a year but good while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this 2 years ago and it quit after about 12 months. Our climate never dipped below 20 degrees and we did not keep it on 24/7.. The house is well made and easy to setup.. The heat from the pad is subtle and just right for a cat house..I just wished it would have lasted longer and didn’t force us to buy another. This time I’m putting a thermo controlled outlet to auto turn this on and off dependent on temp
customer_reviews.author: L. W. Pardue

customer_reviews.title: Great for covered outdoor areas
customer_reviews.text: Our backyard cat loves this new house. We have it under a covered area, so I can’t attest to the weatherproofing capabilities, but it seems like it would hold up to maybe light rain (probably not downpours.) The assembly was easy, but it does leave slight gaps between the pieces so I don’t think it would work well in an uncovered area in rain or snow.
customer_reviews.author: AJR

customer_reviews.title: My little feral buddy loves it!
customer_reviews.text: We tamed a local feral, but with his being such a free spirit, all we could do is TNR him and offer him food and shelter as he made it very clear that he would not be a domestic pet. After a harsh winter with 'Charlie' sleeping in a semi-open bed on top of the fireplace, I decided to get him this shelter. I worried that he would reject the enclosed space, but with openings on both ends offering escape routes, he took right to it. I tested the heating pad and feel confident that next winter will be the warmest, driest winter Charlie will ever experience.
customer_reviews.author: PodGod

customer_reviews.title: False Advertisement
customer_reviews.text: Pictures in advertisement show zippers attaching the roof. The product I received had Velcro only attaching the roof. The Velcro did not line up causing gaps in all four corners allowing the cold weather and rain to get in which defeats the purpose of the product. Returning for refund and buying another product through another website.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G

customer_reviews.title: Best Cat House On The Market!
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely happy with my purchase of this K&H Manufacturing Outdoor Kitty House! It was very easy to set up and it looks great outside. I decided to go with the heated because it gets really cold here in New Jersey. The olive color house looks great on the front porch because it compliments the color of my house. My cat Jinks is happy and warm so I don't have to worry at night if he's okay. I have already recommended this product to many friends because the price is unbeatable and this is a fantastic product! This is the best cat house I have found in many years. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: ChicLady

customer_reviews.title: Worth EVERY Penny!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is worth every penny!! My outdoor cat sleeps on our front covered porch in his bed, however, I wanted him to be warmer this winter, so got him this! He filed into it the moment I finished putting it together and meowed his thanks! Uses it ALL the time! The cover on the heating pad is easy to clean too...(he caught a bird....a chipmonk....another bird. He brings his hot lunch back to his "Hut" to eat in the comfort of his home!) We just LOVE this thing! One word of note, we opted not to install the doors due to it being in an enclosed porch. He likes it better this way!
customer_reviews.author: CNR

customer_reviews.title: I would say that izzie is pretty satisfied. Will update the review this winter once ...
customer_reviews.text: I would say that izzie is pretty satisfied. Will update the review this winter once it gets colder and she is able to use it as it is intended to be used (outside). She seems pretty comfy on the super plush cushion that fits inside. Took me about 5 minutes to set up. The zippers are a little tricky but no big deal. I am super pleased, especially since it seems like she feels right at home and will have a cozy place to chill this winter. I also purchased one of those "temperature" activated outlets so it will save power and keep the heater off until the temperature justifies it being on. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Best cat house so far
customer_reviews.text: Assembled in 5 minutes! My cat loves it....got used to it very quickly. Well built - would not trust for long-term out in the weather solution, but definitely a great option under a porch or other covered area. We keep it under the porch for those colder days. Only complaint is in reference to the flapping clear doors. It allows for the cat to come in but not out, so I removed it. Let’s see how it works through the winter
customer_reviews.author: tptha

customer_reviews.title: Great for a garage and our cat loves it
customer_reviews.text: At first I did not think our cat was going to use this. I tried to coax him in and he was not having it. the next morning when I came out to check on him he came out of the house and he's been using it on and off all day. So glad he has somewhere warm to stay this winter since our garage is not heated. It was also very easy to assemble. I don't think there would be room for another cat in there, but maybe if it was 2 smaller cats or kittens it might work with 2.
customer_reviews.author: Raquel

customer_reviews.title: It does not get hot.
customer_reviews.text: The idea is fantastic, the house is fantastic! The mat needs to be fixed. The first house I got, didn't get hot at all. They sent me a new one. The second house came with in 2 days. I left the mat plugged in for 2 hours, i felt something but I had to put my hand under the cover. I'm sending both back and the shipping is $10 each! Who does that.....
customer_reviews.author: xkatexedgex

customer_reviews.title: My ferals love it!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I thought the 1st cat house I bought was good for my ferals but this one is SO much better! Yes, 20 watts is low but it's keeping my guys warm and they love it. The other house I bought was too small for my male so I needed something bigger and he loves it! Still can't get him used to the doors but in time and as the weather gets colder, I'm sure he'll appreciate them. Excellent buy! Wish I had bought 2 of these from the get-go. Oh well, guess I have to buy another!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: does not heat
customer_reviews.text: the house is great, kitty likes to sleep in it at times, but now it's starting to get cold outside, so plugged in heating pad for the first time, after an hour, no heat. will have to buy another heating pad to keep kitty warm..........disappointed that it doesn't heat. figured that would further entice kitty to sleep in it.
customer_reviews.author: RayneStormRN

customer_reviews.title: It is what it is, and is not what it is not.
customer_reviews.text: I deployed this in my garage, out of the elements. For that use, or perhaps on a protected porch, it is just about perfect. The heating element will not overwhelm, at 20W it gives just enough aid to the cat's own body heat to keep them comfortable - and at a low cost. In a very cold environment, you likely need both flaps installed (cats do not seem to like this too much), and even then my suspicion is it will not be comfortably warm - you would need a higher wattage heated element. For places with few or no bitterly cold nights, strongly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: L. Love

customer_reviews.title: Toasty warm kitty!
customer_reviews.text: We were adopted by an abandoned kitty that refuses to come inside. He was wary of the house at first, so the roof was left off and the front panel left laying open. After a few days, the roof was then propped over half of the house and half alongside the house. After he accepted this much closing in, the roof was put on correctly and the final step a few days later, closing in the front panel without the removable clear plastic door. With this slow approach to sleeping in an enclosed space, kitty is now warm and happy!
customer_reviews.author: Erin Clerico

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: We are so happy with our cat house! Our outside cat gets inside of it and when I feel her she is toasty warm. The house is not waterproof but it is sturdy and weatherproof. I wish the listing would’ve made that clear, but it’s super easy to just wrap it in a tarp to make it waterproof. We put the cat house on the deck behind the grill and draped the waterproof grill cover over the house so the house stays dry and cozy. The flaps on each entrance to the house are sturdy and effective in keeping cold air out. The pad inside is super soft. I highly recommend this product!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mary L.

customer_reviews.title: Best for use in a covered area
customer_reviews.text: The kitty house is fine for a covered area (porch, barn, etc.), but I would not recommend using it completely outside. It is not waterproof. Also, since I haven't had it during a winter yet, I can't comment on its reliability in keeping cats warm all winter. I tested it to make sure that the heating element works, and it does. But in the summer time, I don't have it plugged in. Anyway, my kitty prefers to sit on top of it rather than inside, and she loves to claw the roof. I don't think the roof is going to hold up to regular use as a scratching post, but we'll see.
customer_reviews.author: Teacher2

customer_reviews.title: Weather was 15 degrees and they loved the thing
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to help my 2 ferrets stay warm while visiting family in Nevada. Weather was 15 degrees and they loved the thing. We draped a blanket over the top to help keep it even warmer. They even hang out in the house in our home, which is normally around 68 degrees. Even my Jack Russell Terrier has pushed himself in and nestled into it. Definitely worth the purchase. Plenty of room for 2 ferrets!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: NOT Weatherproof!! Overall good, but not in rain.
customer_reviews.text: SO, this is NOT weatherproof at all! We had a long rainy day yesterday and the inside of the cat house is completely soaked. Both doors were shut on it, but completely soaked. We had it on our porch. I'm very disappointed about that as it's an outdoor house! Now I have to figure out something so it doesn't get soaked in rain and snow.
customer_reviews.author: End Up Here

customer_reviews.title: Don't Believe Fake Reviews!! Not Waterproof AT ALL - Must Be In Enclosed Porch, with Extra Heat
customer_reviews.text: I got this several weeks ago for a stray cat that would hang around once in a while. I would put food in it for her. It got really cold one night and I found her in there early in the morning shivering!! She died shortly after. 20 watts is not enough to heat anything on a cold night. Furthermore, when it rains, the entire thing gets sopping wet, including the interior and heated pad. Also, when the heated pad gets soaked, it triggers the heating mechanism and draws full power as I verified with a current meter.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Maybe warm stray
customer_reviews.text: This house for the money is okay. I like it. If I can get the stray to stay in it for the winter I might get a better one that is a little heavier. However shown with the cat house the 2 pads do not fit the house. They block the doors from opening and closing. I will just put down straw. I ordered 2 so when the first didn’t fit I just canceled the second. But I do like the cat house. But to be on the safe side I did teeter it down with 2 cable and spikes. It does get windy in winter and it is light enough to blow away.
customer_reviews.author: Susan M. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Outdoor cat house
customer_reviews.text: My cat stays outside / in the sun porch and I bought this for her to have a warmer place to snuggle up in on those colder nights. My winters are typically mild and this gives her a warmer place to sleep and stay warm. It was easy to pieces together and in no time she was inside loving it. She’s a pretty fat cat and she has no issues getting in and out. Wish I would have seen the larger house they had available first though. Excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: DC 🐧

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for a kitty who was abandoned by our neighbors when they moved. He will not come in our house as he is very shy, so we were concerned about him surviving the upcoming cold winter this last season (Washington State). It seems to have worked well. He sleeps in this every night on our back patio. We built a small platform on which to place it, so it would not get wet from the water on the patio, and we placed a tarp-covered card table over it to keep the rain off of it, since out patio has no covering. The heat from the pad is just warm, and it will not over-heat the pet.
customer_reviews.author: Sue K.

customer_reviews.title: Great for strays
customer_reviews.text: We have a outside stray that has been coming and going for months and she always would run off under the neighbors house, well it took a couple weeks to get her in the house but once we did she hasn’t left our yard she’s always in it. If we didn’t have a male cat that thinks he owns everything she would be inside also but he doesn’t like her or any other animal so I’m glad we could atleast keep her warm this winter.
customer_reviews.author: Shana Loraine

customer_reviews.title: Cats never used it this winter
customer_reviews.text: This winter 2018-19, our 2 outdoor cats completely disregarded this shelter. When it got bitter cold they were finding places in the barn and still not choosing this. I then tried putting it in the garage and leaving the garage door up enough they could get in (they love the garage). Instead of using the shelter our cat perched herself on the padded seat of our zero-turn (right next to this heated shelter). I have since put a moving blanket on the seat and a little space heater - the cat is there as I write this. So despite all the great reviews apparently our cats think otherwise of this now waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: G. M. Reszel

customer_reviews.title: It looked like it was going to be a dud
customer_reviews.text: My daughter's cat hates the other cats in our house and will not come in. At first, she would not go in the pet house because it looked like a cat carrier. We left one of the top flaps open and now she goes at night and whenever she's cold. It's in our garage, so I can't really comment on weatherproof, and getting the roof zipper started was a bit tricky but the velcro really holds it together well. We have the heated one.
customer_reviews.author: MarkD

customer_reviews.title: Human pee on cat house
customer_reviews.text: Purchased used-Like new, packaging damaged. Arrived in Amazon warehouse box. Part of the cat house has stain & splatter of what looks and smells like human pee. If it had been inspected, this would have been noticed! Pretty gross! Was going to give as a gift to my kid for our recently acquired outdoor cat... Since it's human pee, returning it. Otherwise, product looks great. Good for price. Arrived quickly. But, $30 for a peed on cat house is disappointing. So 2 stars. Will try one more time, because decent product for price.
customer_reviews.author: suzb

customer_reviews.title: No problem with heating element for a straight month of use so far. Am looking at buying another one
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly. I put this inside of a dog house because this is not a waterproof structure and it's not too heavy and could possibly get tossed around in strong wind. We have used it for almost a month straight with no problem. My cat uses it all of the time. UPDATE: We ordered another house for a stray barn kitty that is skiddish. It is inside the barn so it is protected from the elements and she is using it! VERY HAPPY ! Both houses are holding up very well. Heating pads are working fine. Do not put this outside in the weather as the picture "suggests". We are happy with the 2 we are currently using!
customer_reviews.author: Tammy S

customer_reviews.title: Outdoor cat heaven
customer_reviews.text: We adopted a feral cat named "Tag" he prefers to be outside in the garage. We got concerned when weather started dropping below zero. So I bought this heated cat house and set it up he took to it immediately. Now he guards it and will not let anyone near it. The remarks on here about the doors not swinging are easily addressed. The instructions say to adjust the door so it will swing easily they are just attached with velcro. It clearly states in product description not to placed out in the weather but in an area like a covered porch, garage, carport or shed.
customer_reviews.author: Debbi Frey

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it.
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves it. He's a stray we came across and my other cat doesn't like other cats so we had to let him live on out enclosed deck. Since winter is coming up and it gets pretty cold here I wanted to find something that would keep him warm. It's 48 degrees here tonight and he loves it! Took him a few hours to get used to it, but once he did he hasn't came out of it. I felt his fur and it felt really warm, but not hot. Overall this is a really good product.
customer_reviews.author: Wayniac917

customer_reviews.title: Cozy house for my cute stray
customer_reviews.text: I am feeding a stray cat in our neighborhood. It gets cold in NYC so I got this heated house for her instead of the flimsy cardboard boxes she had. As you can see, she’s pretty cozy. The pink towel is her favorite so I have to put it on top of the heating pad so she’ll go inside, even though you’re not suppose to do that (K&H instruction: do not cover the heating pad it might damage the heating mechanism). I have to wrap the house in a black garbage bag because even though it’s for outdoors, it is not rain proof and I have to protect my investment.
customer_reviews.author: shopping girl

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality and my cats LOVE it
customer_reviews.text: Amazing quality and my cats LOVE it! I wish it was slightly bigger because the two of them sleep in it together. What best shows the thought went into making this house is that the power cord is wrapped in wire coil so the cats can't chew on the cord. Since both my cars are cord chewers I fell in love with this thoughtful company. I have it in a screen porch, and have a cat door into the "real" house, but they prefer sleeping in the cat house then in the real house!
customer_reviews.author: GrimeyGal

customer_reviews.title: K&H outdoor kitty house w/heated bed
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a TNR’d kitty that found me and now claims me as a sugar momma. He loves it especially the warm heated pad/bed; so be sure to grab that option if you’re looking for a house for your kitty that stays outside. Very well made, Velcro sides and roof at seams which secured it great. Water resistant and even has a removable door flap. They say it can fit up to 2 cats inside but those would have to be small cats if so. My 9lb kitty fits just fine w/no extra room for another though. Definitely recommend this house.
customer_reviews.author: xavmerck

customer_reviews.title: Works Very Well — after you strong-arm your cat into trying it.
customer_reviews.text: I love that this heated cat house uses very little energy and doesn’t heat the house when not in use. My cats had to be forced inside the to try them out, but now they LOVE their houses. My elderly cat spends the majority of her time inside her house when temperatures are below 50 or it’s just rainy. The ONLY drawback is that a strong wind easily moves them as they are lightweight. A heavier bottom, to anchor them down, would’ve been helpful. But, thankfully, they don’t come unplugged easily.
customer_reviews.author: Mustang Sally

customer_reviews.title: I love this little house.
customer_reviews.text: I set this up for my stray that has claimed me. I have it under my front door overhang where it won’t get wet so that wasn’t a concern. The little pad is fluffy and soft. I’m hoping she’ll use it when the weather gets cold this season. The shipping was really fast too. I’d recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to love these, bought two, but neither one of them warms up. We've put stuff on the heated pads to see if they do warm up by displacing the air cushion, but nothing. I guess the wool padding is better than nothing, but still disappointed to have spent this much money and not have heat.
customer_reviews.author: KsGrl444

customer_reviews.title: Butterfingers loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Butters had to move outdoors at the new house. And it get's cold here -- occasionally in single digits Fahrenheit -- from time to time. She took a while to accept this as her new bed but now she loves it! The clear doors are great for her to keep a watchful eye on the yard and street while out of the wind. She loves the fuzzy bed and, of course, the gentle heat. The house was super-easy to pop up. It lives on the porch under a roof so I can't speak to the absolute weather resistance but it's done fine with blowing rain and snow.
customer_reviews.author: D. Scot Linton

customer_reviews.title: Fluffy, Yellow Fellow, and Lucky
customer_reviews.text: My Kitties love their heated homes! They did not like the door so I improvised it for their needs. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: lwrAmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sleeping place
customer_reviews.text: We put this on the porch for a cat which visits a lot. She loves it and it keeps her sheltered from the wind. It keeps her warm and toasty. As for longevity, that is yet to be seen. I expect it will last a while. And if it only last this winter, I will still feel that it’s an excellent product. On a day that was 10 degrees, she sleeping comfortably and was very warm. She had no interest in leaving until warmer temperatures. I’m sure the house will hold up and if the heating pad happens to quit working, I’ll simply buy another pad.
customer_reviews.author: MSD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for garage or shed
customer_reviews.text: Chuck loves his new heated house! Only giving 4 stars because it’s absolutely not weatherproof. Your outdoor kitty will enjoy this house regardless, but be aware that it will not protect from the rain or snow. I ended up purchasing another larger weather proof house and put this heated “bedroom” inside. Now Chuck is literally living in the lap of luxury! He doesn’t mind the plastic flaps/door at all. This is perfect for a sheltered area such as a garage or shed. Just minus 1 star because it’s made out of material that has NO resistance to moisture.
customer_reviews.author: Tracyann

customer_reviews.title: These electrically heated cat houses are the cat's meow. ...
customer_reviews.text: These electrically heated cat houses are the cat's meow... really! When the temperature increases, the electric heating pad shuts off. As the temperature declines, the heating pad warms enough to please any cat who prefers to live outside, using just 40 watts. There are two doorways, front and back in case a rival or a predator decides to interfere with the feline's tranquility, and flexible doors to keep the warm inside. Each house is built for a single cat, zipping and velcroing together to be assembled without tools. They're not for direct exposure to the elements, but a position on a porch or under a wide roof overhang or carport is ideal... RobtheElder
customer_reviews.author: RobtheElder

customer_reviews.title: Happy kitty
customer_reviews.text: My outdoor kitty loves her new heated house. It's warm, cozy, and comfy. I set this house up in my garage on a table so it isn't in the rain or wind. I wouldn't recommend putting this outdoors on the ground. It would work well on a sheltered porch or in a garage. If using this house in the elements, I would recommend putting it in an upside-down tote with a hole cut out in the front so the house itself is protected by hard plastic or something similar. This is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: PearlyWhites

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality buy this !
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, excellent quality, zipper holds sides to roof, Velcro holds front / back together with removable clear door flaps. Heating paid is soft, cord has its own hole to exit out and this really is a nice pet warming house. For $50, great product and will be buying more as gifts. Canvas exterior army green color that will hold up for years. Honestly I can't imagine anyone being dissatisfied with this product and not sure why you'd want to buy anything more expensive. Your cat will love it !
customer_reviews.author: Spiderman

customer_reviews.title: Poor Functionality
customer_reviews.text: When it gets cold in the winter the Velcro fasteners freeze the the door flaps in place. If you didn't position the door flaps perfectly it will be impossible to correct so cold air will blow out the little heat. Also the flaps are way too ridged and thick. The door flaps should be permanently stitched in place. Simply tape the flap up until the cats accept it. Additionally the bottom of the flap should have a metal rod in place which would be attracted to a low power magnet placed about a millimeter below the lower flap rod to stop it from getting blown open from wind yet easy for the cat to push aside
customer_reviews.author: David R.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This has be GREAT for my 2 cats that like to go outside. We were finding that one would be in the house and the other would be sitting on top of the house so I just bought another one. The will each have one now :). The heating pad is GREAT too. The house is NOT waterproof so it does need shelter and needs to be off the ground or at least that is what we have done and its working well.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: This cat house is bomb proof!
customer_reviews.text: My cats are frickin' monsters, they tried to destroy this thing for three days straight. Even I didn't think this house was gonna last a week. This is a quality build. Keep in mind this cat house is small (hint hint "Kitty House") if you have BIG cats they might not even be able to fit through the door no joke. Still worth trying since Amazon has a 30 day return policy on all items. My cats love it and I expect this house to last many years.
customer_reviews.author: B. C. Pridgin

customer_reviews.title: Best little cat house in NH.
customer_reviews.text: Better than expected, more solid construction than I'd thought (from reading other reviews). Water-repellent, even in heavy snowstorms. I do have it on a front porch but it seems it would last outside for a while. I have straw inside - the flaps have kept snow out of it - completely dry - for weeks. It took a few minutes to assemble - it just zips together, very clever. Photos are from my front porch. The first photo shows overall house. Second photo shows the view from ca'ts perspective from the front to the back.
customer_reviews.author: D&S

customer_reviews.title: 3 years and still great!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the out kitties. It does get wet inside with a lot of rain or snow. The cats dont seem to notice so I don't mind. It's a lot better than sleeping under a car or in the field. There are some days I'm pretty sure they haven't moved at all! We have some harsh winter's so I'm thankful to have something that keeps them safe and warm. This is going on the 3rd year of use. Every spring I take it apart and hose it off. It was worth the money for me. I would definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Wink

customer_reviews.title: K&H Pet Products Outdoor Kitty House, Insulated Cat Shelter - Heated
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our old cat that has to live outside because he urinated and deficated on my carpet for the last time. He can't talk, but best I can tell he seems to like it. No problem figuring out how to push the door flap out of the way to get in/out. We've had a few nights below freezing and he look comfortable in there. Two little kitties might fit in there, but it's really meant for one adult cat. I have it under the porch so I don't have to worry about it getting wet inside.
customer_reviews.author: FlyGirl

customer_reviews.title: My feral cat LOVES this house!
customer_reviews.text: This house is so well made and very sturdy and warm. It is worth every penny! I live where it is now (January) between 0 and 10 degrees each night and there are many feral cats in my neighborhood, which is in a somewhat rural area. I now have two houses on my porch and they are now occupied every night by the same two cats who have come to trust me for food, water, and shelter. It is very rewarding to help these dear creatures and it seems like the humane thing to do. You won't regret purchasing this house and neither will the animal who takes up residence in it. I am very glad I purchased this house.
customer_reviews.author: J.K.

customer_reviews.title: Should of bought this sooner!
customer_reviews.text: I have an outdoor cat and in the winter I let her in the laundry room. Sometimes it's for too long and there's no bathroom in there..this house solved all my problems..she loves it and is in it most of the time now since its cold out..I did go buy a small tarp to put over top to keep the rain off it as I have no covered porch area.as most people I read and investigate forever before making a purchase. Wish I could tell everyone this is a no brainer and your cat will thank you
customer_reviews.author: K. Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Heats only after cat enters and sits inside for awhile
customer_reviews.text: We hoped that this house would help a stray cat deal with some very cold weather. But it turns out that the heated floor pad does not heat without a weight on it for a considerable period. (The test says to leave the weight for 20 minutes, but it may not take that long to warm up.) No frightened, cold cat is going to wait around in a flimsy shelter in hopes of heat. So we've got it plugged in indoors, where our 18-year-old cat enjoys the warmth during this cold spell.
customer_reviews.author: Janet R.

customer_reviews.title: It is exactly as pictured and perfect for one cat!
customer_reviews.text: I think Little Kitty loves it! I KNOW I DO! So far the little outside cat has used it most of the winter. It is so cute to see her on the front porch inside as I come and go. It fits one cat in my opinion as it suggests. I put food in there for her also. The other cats that stay outside know that it is for her. My only advice is you may want to put a tarp over it because as soon a I set it up outside (within an hour or so) a Tom cat peed on it
customer_reviews.author: Misty

customer_reviews.title: We love it!
customer_reviews.text: Product worked well for my big feral Tom cat. Kept him warm and dry. It may be ok for 2 kittens or small cats, however, it seemed a bit snug for the Tom cat that I have. I passed it on to a shy smaller cat who lives indoors but likes to hide in her own space. Bought a bigger one for the feral Tom. He sleeps in it when temps dip low, but he prefers to sleep on top of it. To each his own... Everyone is happy and that's what matters! ❤️❤️❤️
customer_reviews.author: peacelizard

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever...
customer_reviews.text: Our cats love these houses. We're in the north, where winters get down to 15 degrees and colder. We put the houses on our front porch, and our indoor/outdoor cats seek them out multiple times per day. It's so awesome to see their little faces poking out of the front entry: Even in cold weather, the cats prefer to stay in their little homes, rather than come inside -- we have to entice them with food, otherwise they'd just stay there forever. One note: The heating pad only heats up when a cat is on it -- it's pressure-sensitive. Great purchase, and well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: John Bennett

customer_reviews.title: It was super easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my stray kitty family that I’m trying to keep warm this winter. I’ve had the little house for about 1 month and just last night, they finally used it. I am totally relieved and excited. It was super easy to put together, very good material and the pad is comfy, not too thin and soft with a removable cover that can be washed. Only thing is that I wish it was a bit bigger to accomodate multiple cats. Right now my kitty family fits in there well since it is only the mom and two kittens. But for a full grown cat I would think this would just accommodate one to two kitty’s max.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn Leaf

customer_reviews.title: high quality materials
customer_reviews.text: Cats love it, ofc they love any box with a hole in it, much less heated. More importantly the quality is very nice on this, heavy duty canvas, zippered and velcro'd together. Super thick power cord. The heat does not get too intense, just barely warm so you don't have to worry about dangerous effects. Plastic door flaps are removable if yours won't go through them, took off the front door. And not an eyesore, looks very nice.
customer_reviews.author: J.L.H.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely use something to water proof it or cover it in heavy duty plastic.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product! We recently had a stray cat show up at our back door. It's beyond too cold for him to live outside, so I thought I'd try this product. It's amazing! I sprayed it with feliway and placed it up off the ground and covered it in plastic for more weather protection and added heavy bricks to ensure it would stay in place during high winds. He's been sleeping in it every night. I know it's warm in there even with our super cold nights because the windows are all streamed up in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Lou Geno

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, easy to put together. Exactly as described, which is a nice surprise.
customer_reviews.text: VERY well-made. High quality heating mat. This little house was super-easy to assemble. The little stray cat we got it for was so nice, a friend adopted her, so, she didn't get used to the house before I returned (I don't have any other cats) but I have to say this is excellent quality & the heater mat worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: in Illinois

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I was unsure if the feral cat that hangs around would use this. i have been feeding him for about a year and he still will not let me get near him. I put the house together very easily. I put it on my covered porch and plugged it in. I left one flap off so he could get in and out easily. The first night I put it out and plugged it in he used it! I woke up in the morning and he was inside the house! He has used it every night since I put it out. It is very well made and the heat pad is great. Best purchase I have ever made!
customer_reviews.author: keiko

customer_reviews.title: Still his favorite spot on a chilly day...
customer_reviews.text: I got this almost 6 years ago, and have set it up every winter on the "catio" (a covered screened porch tricked out for Bad Cat Grady.) The cat house works just as advertised - heats up when the cat gets in there, and shuts itself off when he leaves. It's plenty roomy for my 12 pounder - probably enough room for 2 if they are smaller. I leave it plugged in all season, and then put it away during warmer weather. BCG loves to sit up there where he can watch Kitty TV (the bird feeder) and survey his realm in toasty comfort. The cat house has held up great, and BCG still thinks it's purrfect - 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: MZ

customer_reviews.title: I was weary...
customer_reviews.text: But my cat freakin loves this! The first day I put it together he was in there laying. Some people were saying the heating pad is always on, but with the one I ordered I think it activates when the kitty is laying on it. I felt it when he wasn't in there and it wasn't very warm. Then again when he was and it's extra warm. Mind you, my cat is SUPER picky with beds and such. So this might be good for your cat if he's the same.
customer_reviews.author: Beard

customer_reviews.title: Provides good shelter in the winter.
customer_reviews.text: I got the larger house for multiple cats so it would accommodate the pressure sensitive heating pad we already had. It was East to put together and made of quality material. We raised it off the ground and it’s sheltered from rain and snow under the rave of the house. Our cat took to it immediately but I had to remove one door. She couldn’t get the hang of pushing through the hard plastic flap. I may make a cloth one to keep her warmer as temperature have gotten down in the low teens here at night. I am very satisfied with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy E. Howard

customer_reviews.title: Can't do better
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it's a great little shelter. It doesn't look waterproof, but it really is, it's warm and the cats love it. I care for feral communities and have had all kinds of shelters out there. This one blends in with the background, has two doors so kitties don't get trapped by wildlife and the plastic "curtain" doors work better than you'd think. And it's cheap! I think for the quality the cost is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: meesha

customer_reviews.title: Great, comfy, warm house
customer_reviews.text: I seriously cannot think of a way this house is bad. We don't use the doors ... Everything is easy to set up. The cat outside, displaced when a neighbor moved, has kept warm and sleeps comfortable in it. We got this because we felt horrible for the darling cat that has grown up in this neighborhood. We'd let him in, but my two indoor cats are opposed to the notion. This gives him shelter from the elements. ********UPDATE********* As it has gotten colder, I've let him in the house. He still uses it occasionally when he is outdoors. We have a heater set up facing it because we don't want to chance him being cold.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Super little cat house!
customer_reviews.text: I have two stray outside cats who chose this for their place of residence. I provided heat mats in the garage for them which they have been using. I then wondered if this enclosed little heated cat house would interest them, due to the better warmth it would provide. I set this next to their other mat, and within a week, I found the two of them snuggled inside the little house. I am very happy they decided to use it as it will provide more shelter for them when the coldest winter days arrive. Very glad I gave it a try as temps can get really cold.
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Kept Kitty Warm
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little cat house that is very easy to assemble. The kitty was okay with the back exit but she had a problem with the front entrance so I had to take it off. I put a blanket over all of it and plugged it in and put it on our front porch which gets a wind tunnel effect and is not enclosed . We had -14 real temperature and kitty was just fine. She's an outdoor cat so she was used to being outside. I don't know that an indoor cat would be able to handle it. But it's a great product easy to assemble and kept my kitty warm.
customer_reviews.author: Cazee

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my big Maine Coone cat!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product to keep my big cat warm and out of the winter weather. I was a little surprised when the instructions said not to use an extension cord. However, we needed to use an extension cord in order to place the cat house out of the elements. We used an approved outdoor heavy duty cord and don't seem to have any problems. It would be nice if the cover for the heated pad was easily removed for cleaning. I have been brushing it off periodically as cats do tend to carry little pieces of soil aid, etc. from flower beds in their fur. Would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Hathaway

customer_reviews.title: Cat loved it immediately
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't be happier! Ordered yesterday at 6:41 p.m. got it today at 2:30 p.m. love Amazon Prime and love this kitty house. We immediately set it up in the living room and our cat got in and laid down, she loved it immediately....she will love it this winter, she loves being outside on our front porch....so glad we ordered, so worth it.
customer_reviews.author: dva

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cats that aren't fully grown.  My 8 year old cat won't fit, but a 1 or 2 year old cat will with ease.
customer_reviews.text: I like this a lot. I have a couple stray cats that have made my backyard their home, but they were just too skinny to survive the winter. I spent part of the summer and fall fattening them up so they stood a chance, but I was still worried about how they were going to survive the cold. One has found a home under my shed, but the other one is too big to fit, so this was a perfect choice. They take turns warming up in there and it has worked out very well. I'm extremely pleased with it and may just have to buy a second one so they both have a home.
customer_reviews.author: OCDetails

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well made kitty condo. Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is an ideal kitty condo! It's a good size for our needs & the self heating blanket I bought to go along with it fits perfect. I put it together in no time & it's quite sturdy. Feral cat i bought it for went in and snoozed the first night! Very, very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Our cats adore their heated houses!
customer_reviews.text: We have two of these now. The first one worked so well that our cats would race to see who could get to it first, so we ordered a second one. We don’t have too many bad weather days, but when we do we know the cats are warm and dry. The first house is over three years old, has held up perfectly, and the warmer still works great. We have them on a mostly-covered porch so they aren’t directly exposed to the elements. We will probably add another one or two of these houses before next winter so that the neighborhood strays have a place during inclement weather.
customer_reviews.author: Diz

customer_reviews.title: 20 stars on this product/brand :)
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect cat house for our outdoor or even indoor cat friend :) my outdoor cat had the cold for over a week so I figured why not try this out during the winter and cold nights to see if staying warm helps and it did!! I catch him in it all the time with a big ol smile snoozing away! If you have an outdoor cat that you love I recommend this 100% if I ever get more outdoors cats I’ll be purchasing this again! Also the heat pads this company sells is beyond what you would expect. I never once this whole winter thought it could have an electrical problem or wouldn’t work/give out.
customer_reviews.author: Chaeni V.

customer_reviews.title: A perfect solution!
customer_reviews.text: We have 1 elderly barn cat left. We worried about her being by herself in the winter and she is VERY unhappy in the house. Within 1 day, she is spending most of her time in the warmth and comfort of the Kitty House. We took off front flap the first three days ( so it would be easier for her to try it out), and then put it back on. We will rest easier at night this winter knowing she is warm and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: EVWEBB

customer_reviews.title: Our cats love this!!
customer_reviews.text: We have three somewhat feral cats that we care for. We purchased this house so that they can stay warm on the cold winter nights. Two of our three cats love this thing! They are all three smaller cats and this house is plenty big for them all to be in there at once if they like. They immediately began using it and will now stay in it on days when it cold and wet as well as overnight. We have placed it in a covered area on our deck so it is out of the weather and stays dry. In my opinion it is well worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Libby White

customer_reviews.title: House is great - door flaps smelled toxic
customer_reviews.text: My previously feral kitty who likes to hide in boxes loves his new house! I did have to remove both the vinyl end flaps. They had a very strong toxic off-gassing smell about them and there is no way I'd consider that strong smell safe for a cat - especially not in an enclosed space like this house. The cat did *not* use the house AT ALL until I removed both door flaps. I had only 1 installed, but the smell was just too strong - he would not go into the house with it on it. I put my head in it and the scent was awful, so I don't blame him.
customer_reviews.author: Jules O'Guin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cat house
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cat house! My cat loves it! It’s size is perfect. My cat uses both front and back doors of the cat house! I temporarily attached the clear front door flap to the back one and put little treats inside until I noticed she started getting in it on her own and saw she was comfortably curled up inside. The heat pad never gets to hot. I had the cat house inside until she got use to it then put it on the screened lani for her. I definitely plan to get another one to keep inside for her too!
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl

customer_reviews.title: Not the dimensions advertised!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The product info specifies an inner dimension of 14" x 18". The actual box that arrived (all four seals on the box were opened so it was used) specifies an inner dimension of 13" x 16.5". The actual measured dimension of the interior is 12.5" x 16.5" making it suitable for a kitten or small cat. A normal size cat is going to have a tough time fitting in this. The material is nice though. Oh, and the heating pad got nowhere near the temp advertised. It kind of got a little bit warm and it measured 13.5" x 18" which is bigger than the interior of the house.
customer_reviews.author: AD in NJ

product_meta.title: K&H Pet Products Outdoor Heated Kitty House Cat Shelter Inches
product_meta.description: Style:Retail Box| Size:HeatedThe K&H Outdoor Kitty House is available in both heated and unheated models and is the original Outdoor Heated Kitty House. K&H products are made with high-quality materials for your pet's comfort and your family's safety. This heated house is excellent for use in barns, garages, porches, and anywhere your indoor/outdoor cat need additional warmth and protection. The included 20 watt MET Safety Listed Indoor/Outdoor Heated Bed inside the K&H Outdoor Heated Kitty House keeps your kitties warm all winter long, even in sub-zero temperatures. The K&H Indoor/Outdoor Heated Pad is thermostatically controlled by an internal preset thermostat to safely keep your pets warm. The K&H Outdoor Heated Kitty Houses are made with heavy denier polyester that makes it water/weather resistant. The walls and roof are insulated to protect your kitty from the harmful elements of winter. The roof of the K&H Outdoor Heated Kitty House hangs over the 2 doors to keep cats warm, safe and dry. The K&H Outdoor Heated Kitty House features two exits with removable plastic flaps so pets cannot be trapped by predators and yet still have sufficient protection. It's easy to assemble and no tools are required. Product includes manufacturer's one year limited warranty. The heated floor included with this product has been rigorously tested and is certified by MET Laboratories to exceed USA and Canadian electrical safety standards. Thank you for helping to protect all outdoor cats from harsh winter weather and create a safe and secure environment for them.
feature_bullets: Our cozy heated cat house is the perfect home for outdoor cats, community cats, and feral cats
The featured 20 watt MET safety listed plush heated pet bed inside the K&H Outdoor Heated Kitty House keeps your kitties warm -- even in sub-zero temperatures; Cord Length - 5.5 feet
The two exits include removable clear door flaps to protect kitty from the harsh elements of winter, and the heated pad cover is conveniently removable and washable for continual use
Perfect for cats that prefer to sleep in garages, porches, barns, or even in colder parts of the house
These heated cat houses have been tested & certified by MET Labs to exceed USA/CA electrical safety standards, they are safe for use indoors and outdoors
One-year limited warranty; If you have questions, please contact us at 1-877-738-5188
Keep all cats of any shape and size warm and comfortable in this easy-to-assemble, winter-proof, insulted cat shelter

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
